connector.description: Send and receive messages from RabbitMQ instances.

camel.source.path.exchangeName.name: camel.source.path.exchangeName
camel.source.path.exchangeName.description: The exchange name determines the exchange to which the produced messages will be sent to. In the case of consumers, the exchange name determines the exchange the queue will be bound to.

camel.source.endpoint.addresses.name: camel.source.endpoint.addresses
camel.source.endpoint.addresses.description: If this option is set, camel-rabbitmq will try to create connection based on the setting of option addresses. The addresses value is a string which looks like server1:12345, server2:12345

camel.source.endpoint.autoDelete.name: camel.source.endpoint.autoDelete
camel.source.endpoint.autoDelete.description: If it is true, the exchange will be deleted when it is no longer in use

camel.source.endpoint.automaticRecoveryE.name: camel.source.endpoint.automaticRecoveryEnabled
camel.source.endpoint.automaticRecoveryE.description: Enables connection automatic recovery (uses connection implementation that performs automatic recovery when existing connection has failures)

camel.source.endpoint.connectionFactory.name: camel.source.endpoint.connectionFactory
camel.source.endpoint.connectionFactory.description: To use a custom RabbitMQ connection factory. When this option is set, all connection options (connectionTimeout, requestedChannelMax...) set on URI are not used

camel.source.endpoint.deadLetterExchange.name: camel.source.endpoint.deadLetterExchange
camel.source.endpoint.deadLetterExchange.description: The name of the dead letter exchange

camel.source.endpoint.deadLetterExchange.name: camel.source.endpoint.deadLetterExchangeType
camel.source.endpoint.deadLetterExchange.description: The type of the dead letter exchange One of: [direct] [fanout] [headers] [topic]

camel.source.endpoint.deadLetterQueue.name: camel.source.endpoint.deadLetterQueue
camel.source.endpoint.deadLetterQueue.description: The name of the dead letter queue

camel.source.endpoint.deadLetterRoutingK.name: camel.source.endpoint.deadLetterRoutingKey
camel.source.endpoint.deadLetterRoutingK.description: The routing key for the dead letter exchange

camel.source.endpoint.declare.name: camel.source.endpoint.declare
camel.source.endpoint.declare.description: If the option is true, camel declare the exchange and queue name and bind them together. If the option is false, camel won't declare the exchange and queue name on the server.

camel.source.endpoint.durable.name: camel.source.endpoint.durable
camel.source.endpoint.durable.description: If we are declaring a durable exchange (the exchange will survive a server restart)

camel.source.endpoint.exchangeType.name: camel.source.endpoint.exchangeType
camel.source.endpoint.exchangeType.description: The exchange type such as direct or topic. One of: [direct] [fanout] [headers] [topic]

camel.source.endpoint.exclusive.name: camel.source.endpoint.exclusive
camel.source.endpoint.exclusive.description: Exclusive queues may only be accessed by the current connection, and are deleted when that connection closes.

camel.source.endpoint.hostname.name: camel.source.endpoint.hostname
camel.source.endpoint.hostname.description: The hostname of the running rabbitmq instance or cluster.

camel.source.endpoint.passive.name: camel.source.endpoint.passive
camel.source.endpoint.passive.description: Passive queues depend on the queue already to be available at RabbitMQ.

camel.source.endpoint.portNumber.name: camel.source.endpoint.portNumber
camel.source.endpoint.portNumber.description: Port number for the host with the running rabbitmq instance or cluster. Default value is 5672.

camel.source.endpoint.queue.name: camel.source.endpoint.queue
camel.source.endpoint.queue.description: The queue to receive messages from

camel.source.endpoint.routingKey.name: camel.source.endpoint.routingKey
camel.source.endpoint.routingKey.description: The routing key to use when binding a consumer queue to the exchange. For producer routing keys, you set the header rabbitmq.ROUTING_KEY.

camel.source.endpoint.skipDlqDeclare.name: camel.source.endpoint.skipDlqDeclare
camel.source.endpoint.skipDlqDeclare.description: If true the producer will not declare and bind a dead letter queue. This can be used if you have also DLQ rabbitmq consumer and you want to avoid argument clashing between Producer and Consumer. This option have no effect, if DLQ configured (deadLetterExchange option is not set).

camel.source.endpoint.skipExchangeDeclar.name: camel.source.endpoint.skipExchangeDeclare
camel.source.endpoint.skipExchangeDeclar.description: This can be used if we need to declare the queue but not the exchange

camel.source.endpoint.skipQueueBind.name: camel.source.endpoint.skipQueueBind
camel.source.endpoint.skipQueueBind.description: If true the queue will not be bound to the exchange after declaring it

camel.source.endpoint.skipQueueDeclare.name: camel.source.endpoint.skipQueueDeclare
camel.source.endpoint.skipQueueDeclare.description: If true the producer will not declare and bind a queue. This can be used for directing messages via an existing routing key.

camel.source.endpoint.autoAck.name: camel.source.endpoint.autoAck
camel.source.endpoint.autoAck.description: If messages should be auto acknowledged

camel.source.endpoint.bridgeErrorHandler.name: camel.source.endpoint.bridgeErrorHandler
camel.source.endpoint.bridgeErrorHandler.description: Allows for bridging the consumer to the Camel routing Error Handler, which mean any exceptions occurred while the consumer is trying to pickup incoming messages, or the likes, will now be processed as a message and handled by the routing Error Handler. By default the consumer will use the org.apache.camel.spi.ExceptionHandler to deal with exceptions, that will be logged at WARN or ERROR level and ignored.

camel.source.endpoint.concurrentConsumer.name: camel.source.endpoint.concurrentConsumers
camel.source.endpoint.concurrentConsumer.description: Number of concurrent consumers when consuming from broker. (eg similar as to the same option for the JMS component).

camel.source.endpoint.consumerTag.name: camel.source.endpoint.consumerTag
camel.source.endpoint.consumerTag.description: Specify a client-generated consumer tag to establish context when invoking the consume operation

camel.source.endpoint.exclusiveConsumer.name: camel.source.endpoint.exclusiveConsumer
camel.source.endpoint.exclusiveConsumer.description: Request exclusive access to the queue (meaning only this consumer can access the queue). This is useful when you want a long-lived shared queue to be temporarily accessible by just one consumer.

camel.source.endpoint.prefetchCount.name: camel.source.endpoint.prefetchCount
camel.source.endpoint.prefetchCount.description: The maximum number of messages that the server will deliver, 0 if unlimited. You need to specify the option of prefetchSize, prefetchCount, prefetchGlobal at the same time

camel.source.endpoint.prefetchEnabled.name: camel.source.endpoint.prefetchEnabled
camel.source.endpoint.prefetchEnabled.description: Enables the quality of service on the RabbitMQConsumer side. You need to specify the option of prefetchSize, prefetchCount, prefetchGlobal at the same time

camel.source.endpoint.prefetchGlobal.name: camel.source.endpoint.prefetchGlobal
camel.source.endpoint.prefetchGlobal.description: If the settings should be applied to the entire channel rather than each consumer You need to specify the option of prefetchSize, prefetchCount, prefetchGlobal at the same time

camel.source.endpoint.prefetchSize.name: camel.source.endpoint.prefetchSize
camel.source.endpoint.prefetchSize.description: The maximum amount of content (measured in octets) that the server will deliver, 0 if unlimited. You need to specify the option of prefetchSize, prefetchCount, prefetchGlobal at the same time

camel.source.endpoint.reQueue.name: camel.source.endpoint.reQueue
camel.source.endpoint.reQueue.description: This is used by the consumer to control rejection of the message. When the consumer is complete processing the exchange, and if the exchange failed, then the consumer is going to reject the message from the RabbitMQ broker. If the header CamelRabbitmqRequeue is present then the value of the header will be used, otherwise this endpoint value is used as fallback. If the value is false (by default) then the message is discarded/dead-lettered. If the value is true, then the message is re-queued.

camel.source.endpoint.exceptionHandler.name: camel.source.endpoint.exceptionHandler
camel.source.endpoint.exceptionHandler.description: To let the consumer use a custom ExceptionHandler. Notice if the option bridgeErrorHandler is enabled then this option is not in use. By default the consumer will deal with exceptions, that will be logged at WARN or ERROR level and ignored.

camel.source.endpoint.exchangePattern.name: camel.source.endpoint.exchangePattern
camel.source.endpoint.exchangePattern.description: Sets the exchange pattern when the consumer creates an exchange. One of: [InOnly] [InOut] [InOptionalOut]

camel.source.endpoint.threadPoolSize.name: camel.source.endpoint.threadPoolSize
camel.source.endpoint.threadPoolSize.description: The consumer uses a Thread Pool Executor with a fixed number of threads. This setting allows you to set that number of threads.

camel.source.endpoint.allowMessageBodySe.name: camel.source.endpoint.allowMessageBodySerialization
camel.source.endpoint.allowMessageBodySe.description: Whether to allow Java serialization of the message body or not. If this value is true, the message body will be serialized on the producer side using Java serialization, if no type converter can handle the message body. On the consumer side, it will deserialize the message body if this value is true and the message contains a CamelSerialize header. Setting this value to true may introduce a security vulnerability as it allows an attacker to attempt to deserialize to a gadget object which could result in a RCE or other security vulnerability.

camel.source.endpoint.args.name: camel.source.endpoint.args
camel.source.endpoint.args.description: Specify arguments for configuring the different RabbitMQ concepts, a different prefix is required for each: Exchange: arg.exchange. Queue: arg.queue. Binding: arg.binding. DLQ: arg.dlq.queue. DLQ binding: arg.dlq.binding. For example to declare a queue with message ttl argument: http://localhost:5672/exchange/queueargs=arg.queue.x-message-ttl=60000

camel.source.endpoint.clientProperties.name: camel.source.endpoint.clientProperties
camel.source.endpoint.clientProperties.description: Connection client properties (client info used in negotiating with the server)

camel.source.endpoint.networkRecoveryInt.name: camel.source.endpoint.networkRecoveryInterval
camel.source.endpoint.networkRecoveryInt.description: Network recovery interval in milliseconds (interval used when recovering from network failure)

camel.source.endpoint.requestedChannelMa.name: camel.source.endpoint.requestedChannelMax
camel.source.endpoint.requestedChannelMa.description: Connection requested channel max (max number of channels offered)

camel.source.endpoint.requestedFrameMax.name: camel.source.endpoint.requestedFrameMax
camel.source.endpoint.requestedFrameMax.description: Connection requested frame max (max size of frame offered)

camel.source.endpoint.requestedHeartbeat.name: camel.source.endpoint.requestedHeartbeat
camel.source.endpoint.requestedHeartbeat.description: Connection requested heartbeat (heart-beat in seconds offered)

camel.source.endpoint.requestTimeout.name: camel.source.endpoint.requestTimeout
camel.source.endpoint.requestTimeout.description: Set timeout for waiting for a reply when using the InOut Exchange Pattern (in milliseconds)

camel.source.endpoint.topologyRecoveryEn.name: camel.source.endpoint.topologyRecoveryEnabled
camel.source.endpoint.topologyRecoveryEn.description: Enables connection topology recovery (should topology recovery be performed)

camel.source.endpoint.transferException.name: camel.source.endpoint.transferException
camel.source.endpoint.transferException.description: When true and an inOut Exchange failed on the consumer side send the caused Exception back in the response

camel.source.endpoint.sslProtocol.name: camel.source.endpoint.sslProtocol
camel.source.endpoint.sslProtocol.description: Enables SSL on connection, accepted value are true, TLS and 'SSLv3

camel.source.endpoint.trustManager.name: camel.source.endpoint.trustManager
camel.source.endpoint.trustManager.description: Configure SSL trust manager, SSL should be enabled for this option to be effective

camel.source.endpoint.username.name: camel.source.endpoint.username
camel.source.endpoint.username.description: Username in case of authenticated access

camel.component.rabbitmq.addresses.name: camel.component.rabbitmq.addresses
camel.component.rabbitmq.addresses.description: If this option is set, camel-rabbitmq will try to create connection based on the setting of option addresses. The addresses value is a string which looks like server1:12345, server2:12345

camel.component.rabbitmq.autoDelete.name: camel.component.rabbitmq.autoDelete
camel.component.rabbitmq.autoDelete.description: If it is true, the exchange will be deleted when it is no longer in use

camel.component.rabbitmq.connectionFacto.name: camel.component.rabbitmq.connectionFactory
camel.component.rabbitmq.connectionFacto.description: To use a custom RabbitMQ connection factory. When this option is set, all connection options (connectionTimeout, requestedChannelMax...) set on URI are not used

camel.component.rabbitmq.deadLetterExcha.name: camel.component.rabbitmq.deadLetterExchange
camel.component.rabbitmq.deadLetterExcha.description: The name of the dead letter exchange

camel.component.rabbitmq.deadLetterExcha.name: camel.component.rabbitmq.deadLetterExchangeType
camel.component.rabbitmq.deadLetterExcha.description: The type of the dead letter exchange One of: [direct] [fanout] [headers] [topic]

camel.component.rabbitmq.deadLetterQueue.name: camel.component.rabbitmq.deadLetterQueue
camel.component.rabbitmq.deadLetterQueue.description: The name of the dead letter queue

camel.component.rabbitmq.deadLetterRouti.name: camel.component.rabbitmq.deadLetterRoutingKey
camel.component.rabbitmq.deadLetterRouti.description: The routing key for the dead letter exchange

camel.component.rabbitmq.declare.name: camel.component.rabbitmq.declare
camel.component.rabbitmq.declare.description: If the option is true, camel declare the exchange and queue name and bind them together. If the option is false, camel won't declare the exchange and queue name on the server.

camel.component.rabbitmq.durable.name: camel.component.rabbitmq.durable
camel.component.rabbitmq.durable.description: If we are declaring a durable exchange (the exchange will survive a server restart)

camel.component.rabbitmq.exclusive.name: camel.component.rabbitmq.exclusive
camel.component.rabbitmq.exclusive.description: Exclusive queues may only be accessed by the current connection, and are deleted when that connection closes.

camel.component.rabbitmq.hostname.name: camel.component.rabbitmq.hostname
camel.component.rabbitmq.hostname.description: The hostname of the running RabbitMQ instance or cluster.

camel.component.rabbitmq.passive.name: camel.component.rabbitmq.passive
camel.component.rabbitmq.passive.description: Passive queues depend on the queue already to be available at RabbitMQ.

camel.component.rabbitmq.portNumber.name: camel.component.rabbitmq.portNumber
camel.component.rabbitmq.portNumber.description: Port number for the host with the running rabbitmq instance or cluster.

camel.component.rabbitmq.skipExchangeDec.name: camel.component.rabbitmq.skipExchangeDeclare
camel.component.rabbitmq.skipExchangeDec.description: This can be used if we need to declare the queue but not the exchange

camel.component.rabbitmq.skipQueueBind.name: camel.component.rabbitmq.skipQueueBind
camel.component.rabbitmq.skipQueueBind.description: If true the queue will not be bound to the exchange after declaring it

camel.component.rabbitmq.skipQueueDeclar.name: camel.component.rabbitmq.skipQueueDeclare
camel.component.rabbitmq.skipQueueDeclar.description: If true the producer will not declare and bind a queue. This can be used for directing messages via an existing routing key.

camel.component.rabbitmq.autoAck.name: camel.component.rabbitmq.autoAck
camel.component.rabbitmq.autoAck.description: If messages should be auto acknowledged

camel.component.rabbitmq.bridgeErrorHand.name: camel.component.rabbitmq.bridgeErrorHandler
camel.component.rabbitmq.bridgeErrorHand.description: Allows for bridging the consumer to the Camel routing Error Handler, which mean any exceptions occurred while the consumer is trying to pickup incoming messages, or the likes, will now be processed as a message and handled by the routing Error Handler. By default the consumer will use the org.apache.camel.spi.ExceptionHandler to deal with exceptions, that will be logged at WARN or ERROR level and ignored.

camel.component.rabbitmq.exclusiveConsum.name: camel.component.rabbitmq.exclusiveConsumer
camel.component.rabbitmq.exclusiveConsum.description: Request exclusive access to the queue (meaning only this consumer can access the queue). This is useful when you want a long-lived shared queue to be temporarily accessible by just one consumer.

camel.component.rabbitmq.prefetchCount.name: camel.component.rabbitmq.prefetchCount
camel.component.rabbitmq.prefetchCount.description: The maximum number of messages that the server will deliver, 0 if unlimited. You need to specify the option of prefetchSize, prefetchCount, prefetchGlobal at the same time

camel.component.rabbitmq.prefetchEnabled.name: camel.component.rabbitmq.prefetchEnabled
camel.component.rabbitmq.prefetchEnabled.description: Enables the quality of service on the RabbitMQConsumer side. You need to specify the option of prefetchSize, prefetchCount, prefetchGlobal at the same time

camel.component.rabbitmq.prefetchGlobal.name: camel.component.rabbitmq.prefetchGlobal
camel.component.rabbitmq.prefetchGlobal.description: If the settings should be applied to the entire channel rather than each consumer You need to specify the option of prefetchSize, prefetchCount, prefetchGlobal at the same time

camel.component.rabbitmq.prefetchSize.name: camel.component.rabbitmq.prefetchSize
camel.component.rabbitmq.prefetchSize.description: The maximum amount of content (measured in octets) that the server will deliver, 0 if unlimited. You need to specify the option of prefetchSize, prefetchCount, prefetchGlobal at the same time

camel.component.rabbitmq.threadPoolSize.name: camel.component.rabbitmq.threadPoolSize
camel.component.rabbitmq.threadPoolSize.description: The consumer uses a Thread Pool Executor with a fixed number of threads. This setting allows you to set that number of threads.

camel.component.rabbitmq.args.name: camel.component.rabbitmq.args
camel.component.rabbitmq.args.description: Specify arguments for configuring the different RabbitMQ concepts, a different prefix is required for each: Exchange: arg.exchange. Queue: arg.queue. Binding: arg.binding. DLQ: arg.dlq.queue. DLQ Binding: arg.dlq.binding. For example to declare a queue with message ttl argument: http://localhost:5672/exchange/queueargs=arg.queue.x-message-ttl=60000

camel.component.rabbitmq.autoDetectConne.name: camel.component.rabbitmq.autoDetectConnectionFactory
camel.component.rabbitmq.autoDetectConne.description: Whether to auto-detect looking up RabbitMQ connection factory from the registry. When enabled and a single instance of the connection factory is found then it will be used. An explicit connection factory can be configured on the component or endpoint level which takes precedence.

camel.component.rabbitmq.automaticRecove.name: camel.component.rabbitmq.automaticRecoveryEnabled
camel.component.rabbitmq.automaticRecove.description: Enables connection automatic recovery (uses connection implementation that performs automatic recovery when connection shutdown is not initiated by the application)

camel.component.rabbitmq.autowiredEnable.name: camel.component.rabbitmq.autowiredEnabled
camel.component.rabbitmq.autowiredEnable.description: Whether autowiring is enabled. This is used for automatic autowiring options (the option must be marked as autowired) by looking up in the registry to find if there is a single instance of matching type, which then gets configured on the component. This can be used for automatic configuring JDBC data sources, JMS connection factories, AWS Clients, etc.

camel.component.rabbitmq.clientPropertie.name: camel.component.rabbitmq.clientProperties
camel.component.rabbitmq.clientPropertie.description: Connection client properties (client info used in negotiating with the server)

camel.component.rabbitmq.networkRecovery.name: camel.component.rabbitmq.networkRecoveryInterval
camel.component.rabbitmq.networkRecovery.description: Network recovery interval in milliseconds (interval used when recovering from network failure)

camel.component.rabbitmq.requestedChanne.name: camel.component.rabbitmq.requestedChannelMax
camel.component.rabbitmq.requestedChanne.description: Connection requested channel max (max number of channels offered)

camel.component.rabbitmq.requestedFrameM.name: camel.component.rabbitmq.requestedFrameMax
camel.component.rabbitmq.requestedFrameM.description: Connection requested frame max (max size of frame offered)

camel.component.rabbitmq.requestedHeartb.name: camel.component.rabbitmq.requestedHeartbeat
camel.component.rabbitmq.requestedHeartb.description: Connection requested heartbeat (heart-beat in seconds offered)

camel.component.rabbitmq.requestTimeout.name: camel.component.rabbitmq.requestTimeout
camel.component.rabbitmq.requestTimeout.description: Set timeout for waiting for a reply when using the InOut Exchange Pattern (in milliseconds)

camel.component.rabbitmq.topologyRecover.name: camel.component.rabbitmq.topologyRecoveryEnabled
camel.component.rabbitmq.topologyRecover.description: Enables connection topology recovery (should topology recovery be performed)

camel.component.rabbitmq.transferExcepti.name: camel.component.rabbitmq.transferException
camel.component.rabbitmq.transferExcepti.description: When true and an inOut Exchange failed on the consumer side send the caused Exception back in the response

camel.component.rabbitmq.sslProtocol.name: camel.component.rabbitmq.sslProtocol
camel.component.rabbitmq.sslProtocol.description: Enables SSL on connection, accepted value are true, TLS and 'SSLv3

camel.component.rabbitmq.trustManager.name: camel.component.rabbitmq.trustManager
camel.component.rabbitmq.trustManager.description: Configure SSL trust manager, SSL should be enabled for this option to be effective

camel.component.rabbitmq.username.name: camel.component.rabbitmq.username
camel.component.rabbitmq.username.description: Username in case of authenticated access
